content: How many Earths can fit inside the Sun?

Approximately 1.3 million Earths can fit inside the Sun. The Sun has a diameter of about 1.4 million kilometers, while the Earth has a diameter of about 12,742 kilometers. The volume of a sphere is proportional to the cube of its radius, so the ratio of their volumes is roughly (1.4 million / 12,742)^3, which is about 1.3 million.
